ReportSection.name: Overview
ReportSection.ReportItem:
The objectives of the NCE program are to mobilize multi-disciplinary research capacity from across Canada, engage partners from multiple academic institutions and various public and private-sector organizations, train the next generation of highly qualified people, work with end users to accelerate the creation and application of new knowledge as well as increase collaboration between research in Canada and abroad.

The aim of the form is to allow the RMC to assess the progress, performance against the key impact objectives of AGE-WELL and demonstrate that the network is effectively working to achieve our goals. Reporting is crucial to the ongoing success and future of AGE-WELL.

AGE-WELL produces products (technologies, services and policy) that MUST have impact. Progress towards achieving these products can be defined and measure across all projects in a consistent fashion. The Product Readiness Levels (PRL) is a method of estimating maturity and progress towards a product across a 9 point scale. It is based on the Technology Readiness Levels (TRL), which is a well-established approach in engineering and other fields. It has been adapted for use in AGE-WELL in order to be inclusive of the different types of products and research that our members conduct. Part of this adaptation has been adopting a modified scale that maps the original 9 TRL levels into 5 stages. AGE-WELL has adapted both scales to be inclusive of the types of projects and products that are part of the Network. Please refer to the Product Readiness Levels Guideline table for definitions of the PRL levels, as well as example outputs at each level across product type. Note that the current outputs in this table are only examples and will be added to as we continue to roll out this process, and we receive feedback from members of AGE-WELL.

Projects are required to justify the current PRL stage they are at, and which stage they will be at one year later. It is expected that projects will progress through theses stages at an appropriate pace, in order to receive ongoing investment however it should be noted that it is expected that some projects may remain at a specific PRL longer than others. Justification and a demonstration of progress is required.

Each project is required to complete 2 tables related to the 5 NCE objectives (Scientific Excellence, Transdisciplinary Working, Networking and Partnerships, Knowledge Mobilization, Commercialization and HQP Training) for the past year and for the upcoming year. All projects are asked to complete the tables relevant to their project; not all projects may be able to complete both the KM and Commercialization tables. These tables will be used by the RMC to create a Balance Scorecard to determine the progress projects are making across the TRL continuum each year. The outcome of RMC review of each project will be used to make a recommendation to the AGE-WELL Board of Directors with respect to ongoing funding levels and continuation of projects.

The report consists of qualitative and quantitative information to appropriately capture the progress your project is making on the key impact area.

The report requests three types of information:

  1. Narrative- a short written account of what the project has been doing to achieve impact;
  2. Metrics- quantitative data (automatically collected via reporting on Forum); and
  3. Case study- a short vignette that describes an outstanding work or achievement by the project.

ReportSection.name: Assessment & Readiness
ReportSection.title: Project Assessment and Readiness Level
ReportSection.ReportItem: Projects can be at different stages of product readiness, from concept to deployment and adoption. Please refer to the guidelines in order to define which stage best characterises your project.

ReportItem.options: Technology product - a device or system that someone will buy or adopt|Policy/practice product - information that will be used by stakeholder or end-user, including others in the network|Service product- a service or information product that will be used by another entity

ReportSection.ReportItem:
What kind of product are you developing (check all that apply):

{$item}

Describe what your product will be and the potential added value of what you are completing in your project. Include the following:

  • WHAT does it look like?
  • WHO is going to use is?
  • WHEN/WHERE is it going to be used?
  • HOW is it going to get to market/adopted?
  • WHY will someone adopt/buy it (value proposition)?
 {$item}

AGE-WELL is expected to deliver significant economic benefits through new products, enterprises, improved services and the net monetary value of improved health and independence of seniors and caregivers. How will the outcomes of your project benefit the Canadian economy and what the progress your project has made in achieving these outcomes?

{$item}

AGE-WELL is expected to have significant benefits to Canadian society through improved quality of life, health and independence of seniors, improved policy, practice and services. How will the outcomes of your project benefit the Canadian society?

{$item}

ReportItem.options: INNOVATION RESEARCH (PRL 1) basic principles observed through novel research|INCUBATOR (PRL 2-3) product concept formulated; experimental proof of concept|PROTOTYPE (PRL 4-5) product validated in lab; product validated in relevant environment|EXPERIMENTAL IMPLEMENTATION (PRL 6-7) product demonstrated in relevant environment|OUTCOMES (PRL 8-9) product complete and qualified; actual product proven in operational environment

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Use the attached supporting documents (AGE-WELL PRL Guidelines), determine the “Product Readiness Level” (PRL) your product currently at:

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Transdisciplinary
ReportSection.title: Transdisciplinary Working
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Essential to all NCE networks is the multi-disciplinarity of the approach to challenges. Projects are expected to transcend disciplinary boundaries by developing shared concepts and understanding, goals and working practices in order to work effectively as a single team to tackle the complexity of real-wold problem domains. Projects should involve collaboration where partnership working allows expertise, knowledge and joining working practices to transcend disciplinary boundaries.

Review scorecard

Describe what your project has done to create a transdisciplinary working environment?

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Networking
ReportSection.title: Networking and Partnerships
ReportSection.ReportItem:
The project must demonstrate that it has brought together the key individuals and organizations needed to generate and implement multifaceted solutions to the complex challenges it is designed to address. It must be built on relationships with partners and the receptor community that will accelerate the activities, outcomes and impact of the project.

  • the social innovations to be implemented as a result of the Network  and the extent to which these will contribute to more effective public policy in Canada;
  • effective collaboration with the private, public and not-for-profit sectors in technology, market development, and public policy development;
  • the extent to which the Network will help the partners develop strong receptor capacity to exploit current and future research breakthroughs;

Review scorecard

Describe how your project has actively engaged with key partners in order to accelerate the research activities and outcomes and how partners have contributed to project activities

ReportSection.tooltip: Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation - Knowledge Mobilization
ReportSection.name: Knowledge Mobilization
ReportSection.title: Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation - Knowledge Mobilization
ReportSection.ReportItem: NCE Networks are expected to generate social and economic benefits by ensuring the rapid flow of knowledge, ideas and innovations from researchers to Canadian receptors. Projects are expected to demonstrate that the appropriate activities will be undertaken and the appropriate resources allocated to maximize those benefits through effective stakeholder engagement and communication.

Review scorecard

How has the project engaged and actively communicated with stakeholders to build receptor capacity and to ensure that knowledge reaches and is used by them?

ReportSection.tooltip: Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation - Commercialization
ReportSection.name: Commercialization
ReportSection.title: Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation - Commercialization
ReportSection.ReportItem: Projects are expected to generate social and economic benefits by ensuring the rapid flow of intellectual property (IP) from research into the Canadian economy in terms of new products, services and business ventures. Projects that aim to create technology and/or service products (see previous sections) are expected to demonstrate that the appropriate activities have been undertaken and the appropriate resources allocated to the commercialization of their IP.

Review scorecard

How has your project progressed to ensure the rapid flow of intellectual property (IP) from research into the Canadian economy in terms of new products, services and business ventures?

ReportSection.name: HQP Training
ReportSection.ReportItem: Training is expected to add value to the formal training initiatives already available through the academic community and should aim at helping HQP find employment in the Canadian economy, particularly in sectors related to technology and aging. HQP should be directly involved in the range of activities in a multi-disciplinary team research project and should work closely with industry and community partners and be involved in collaborating within the Age-Well research network and partner universities.

Review scorecard

Describe how the project has encouraged and supported the training and career progression of HQP beyond the disciplinary academic training they would normally receive

{$item}
What approximate percent of this year’s project resources ($) are devoted to this area: {$item}%

ReportSection.name: PRL Justifications
ReportSection.title: PRL Justifications & Case Studies
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Use the information you have filled out above to give a justification for the PRL that you have selected including progress made over the past year from one level to the next. If you have not progressed to another PRL provide justification for why

{$item}

Which PRL level do you expect to be at in one year from now? Provide a brief justification and key steps you will be taking to move to the next level

{$item}

Please provide a short case study of outstanding work or achievement in any of the above evaluation impact areas (Scientific Excellence, Networking and Partnerships, Knowledge Mobilization, Commercialization and HQP Training). Case studies provide an opportunity for a better understanding of the work being completed and its impact in the real world. These stories are a great opportunity to promote the amazing work being accomplished within AGE-WELL.

{$item}
